articles.title: The Results of the State of JavaScript 2023 Survey
articles.description: It feels odd including something about 2023 in June 2024, but the results of the major annual JavaScript developer survey are now out. It‚Äôs interesting to see what features JS devs do and don‚Äôt use, changes in library popularity over time, what build tools people are using, the divide between JavaScript and TypeScript usage, and much more besides.
articles.author: Devographics

articles.title: How JavaScript is Finally Improving the Module Experience
articles.description: Multiple long-term proposals collectively known as ‚Äúmodule harmony‚Äù will complete the features lost as developers move away from CommonJS.
articles.author: Mary Branscombe / The New Stack

articles.title: How React 19 (Almost) Made the Internet Slower
articles.description: Even changes that are planned in advance can have big effects on the developer experience if people aren‚Äôt aware of them. A change to Suspense in React 19 led to much confusion and surprise, but the story has a happy ending with the React team ready to listen to end users more closely.
articles.author: Henrique Yuji

articles.title: ‚ñ∂¬†¬†3D in TypeScript with Raycasting
articles.description: Raycasting is a somewhat old fashioned technique to render 3D environments (you may have seen it in 1992‚Äôs Wolfenstein 3D) but it‚Äôs easy to understand and worth implementing at least once.
articles.author: Tsoding Daily

articles.title: Live Types in a TypeScript Monorepo
articles.description: Several strategies to make a TypeScript monorepo feel more ‚Äúalive‚Äù in the sense of the propagation of changes.
articles.author: Colin McDonnell

articles.title: What Happens When a Major npm Library Goes Commercial?
articles.description: The ua-parser-js library is commonly used to parse user agent strings and gets over 12 million downloads a month, but it has recently switched to AGPL+commercial licensing.
articles.author: Matteo Collina

articles.title: Dual Publishing ESM and CJS Modules with tsup and 'Are the Types¬†Wrong'
articles.description: tsup makes it easy to bundle TypeScript libraries and 'Are the Types Wrong?' analyzes packages for issues with their types.
articles.author: John Reilly

articles.title: Phoenix: A macOS Window Manager You Can Script with JS
articles.description: macOS is set to adding more window management features in Sequoia, but how about something you can script entirely with JavaScript right now? GitHub repo.
articles.author: Kasper Hirvikoski

articles.title: JSONEditor: A Component for Viewing and Editing JSON
articles.description: If your app needs to let users work with JSON directly, this is worth a look. It supports both text and tree views and is cross browser compatible. Live demo.
articles.author: Jos de Jong

articles.title: Rooster v9.6: Microsoft's Framework-Independent Rich Text Editor
articles.description: A rich-text editor control neatly nested inside a single div element (demo). Several years old, but still maintained.
articles.author: Microsoft

articles.title: NLUX: A Library for Rendering Conversational AI Experiences
articles.description: If you want to spin up a ChatGPT-style conversational experience on top of your own services or third party AI backends, this provides the pieces needed to get an interface up quickly. GitHub repo.
articles.author: Salmen Hichri

articles.description: Evan You, the creator of Vue.js, recently gave ‚ñ∂Ô∏è a talk on 10 years of Vue, covering both its past and future.
Over on Twitter/X, Daniel Lemire showed off a situation where Bun is much faster than Node.js, even when both are using the same underlying library, due to the complexities the V8 engine introduces.
üéµ Did you know TC39 now has its own pop group and a song?
htmx 2.0 ‚Äì The popular 'access lots of JS and Web API features via special HTML attributes' library gets a new major version mainly to remove deprecations and drop IE support.
Electron 31 ‚Äì The cross-platform desktop app framework steps up to Chromium 126, Node 20.14, and V8 12.6.
Relay 17 ‚Äì Facebook's declaritive GraphQL client for React.
ESLint 9.5, Serverless Framework v4, pnpm 9.4
Electron Store 10.0 ‚Äì Simple data persistence for Electron apps.
React Date Picker 7.1 ‚Äì Simple date picker component. (Demo.)
Monads 0.7 ‚Äì Rust-inspired Option, Result, and Either types.
Plasmo 0.88 ‚Äì "Like Next.js for browser extensions."
MUI X 7.7 ‚Äì Popular React component suite.
React Tag Autocomplete 7.3

articles.title: Inline Conditionals in CSS?
articles.description: Last week, the CSS Working Group resolved to add an inline if() to CSS. Seen by many as an overwhelmingly positive step forward, but one that raises lots of questions too. Lea explains what this all means, and why it‚Äôs exciting.
articles.author: Lea Verou

articles.title: The 2-Page Login Pattern, and How To Fix It
articles.description: Explores the reasons behind the now seemingly pervasive design choice of login forms split across multiple screens, sharing some alternative solutions that aim to ‚Äúcreate a more efficient and user-friendly authentication experience‚Äù.
articles.author: Vitaly Friedman

articles.title: üï∂Ô∏è¬†Trying Out Your Site in the Spatial Web
articles.description: If you‚Äôve any curiosity about how your site looks and performs in Apple‚Äôs visionOS, this guide from the WebKit team tells you what you need to know to get started (looking at developer tools, testing, debugging, etc.)
articles.author: WebKit (Apple)

articles.title: Flow Charts with CSS Anchor Positioning
articles.description: The recently introduced CSS Anchor Position API can be used for more than just popovers and tooltips ‚Äî as demonstrated in this post, showing us how to create flow charts and diagrams with just CSS. This GIF shared on Twitter is a good way to get a quick grasp on what‚Äôs possible here.
articles.author: Cory Rylan

articles.title: ‚ùÑÔ∏è¬†Engineering for Slow Internet
articles.description: A post about minimizing user frustration for those on slower connections. This might sell you on it: ‚ÄúI got partway through writing this post while I was still in Antarctica‚Äù.
articles.author: brr

articles.title: Shape Lens Blur Effect with SDFs and WebGL
articles.description: An introduction on harnessing the power of Signed Distance Fields (SDFs) to draw shapes in WebGL and create interactive effects, such as lens blur.
articles.author: Guillaume Lanier

articles.title: Safari 18: What Web Features Are Usable Across Browsers?
articles.description: Stefan outlines what new developer features are in the beta of Safari 18, and when it will be safe to use them more broadly.
articles.author: Stefan Judis

articles.title: How BBC News Writes Text Descriptions and Alt Text
articles.description: Considered guidelines for a range of images (decorative, informative, of people, etc.)
articles.author: BBC

articles.title: Rooster v9.6: Microsoft's Framework-Independent Rich Text¬†Editor
articles.description: A JavaScript-based rich-text editor that's neatly nested inside one div element (there's a demo here). Edits performed by end users are handled in simple ways to generate the final HTML. Several years old, but still maintained.
articles.author: Microsoft

articles.title: Pic Smaller: An Open-Source Batch Image Compression Tool
articles.description: Supports intelligent compression for JPEG, PNG, WebP, AVIF, SVG, and GIF, and is fully local.
articles.author: Pic Smaller

articles.title: Entity Code: A Clear and Quick Reference to HTML Entities Codes
articles.description: This is actually a project from 2009 (considered ‚Äúretro‚Äù in web years!) but still useful as a quick way to find the most common copy/paste characters and their corresponding entity codes.
articles.author: webmasterish

articles.title: sveltekit-ultrafast: A Blazing Fast SvelteKit Boilerplate
articles.description: An all-in-one starter kit for building apps with SvelteKit, Tailwind, and TypeScript. Also includes DaisyUI, Supabase for auth, Stripe for payments, and Contentful for setting up a blog.
articles.author: Jacob

articles.title: Teranoptia: A Typeface Representing Plants and Animals
articles.description: In case you were looking to add ‚Äúchimeric creatures‚Äù and similar symbols, inspired by medieval illustrations, to a design using just your keyboard. A peculiar typeface, and free to use.
articles.author: tunera type foundry
